section.title: Kernel.c File Reference
section.para: Included by dependency diagram for Kernel.c

listitem.para: struct KL_PACKET

static const int DEVICE_BUFFER_SIZE
Amount of buffer for each device type.

static const int JSON_TOKEN_CARDINALITY
Maximum amount of JSON tokens in a message.

static const int MAX_MSG_SIZE
Maximum message size.

static KERNEL_FRAME Uart1ReceiveBuf
allocate \a DEVICE_BUFFER_SIZE of \a KERNEL_FRAME for uart1.

int Uart1RcivBufRdPtr
UART1 received buffer read pointer.

int Uart1RcivBufWrPtr
UART1 received buffer write pointer.

JSON parser instance from jsmn.c.

para.emphasis: JSON tokes paresed by \a _parser are stored inside tokens.
for each device type there is one slot on the kernel

listitem.para:
char _uart1AccBuf
a temporary accumulator array for holding the received messages from uart1

char _uart2AccBuf
a temporary accumulator array for holding the received messages from uart2

char _uart3AccBuf
a temporary accumulator array for holding the received messages from uart3

char _uart4AccBuf
a temporary accumulator array for holding the received messages from uart4

InstrumentStart _startupFunction
after successful bootup, kernel calls _startupFunction

generator send buffer mutex.

volatile bool actMutex

display send buffer mutex.

static int u1MsgSize

static int u3MsgSize

void KL_ClearKernelMemory ( )
kernel private function.

void KL_CallSlotHandler ( KERNEL_FRAME _frame)
kernal private function.

void KL_StartDispacherEngine ( )
starts the dispacher engine to start dispatch the buffers contents.

void KL_DistributeFrames ( )
the dispacher engin executes KL_DistributeFrames periodically.

void EnqueueFrameIntoSendBuffer ( KL_PACKET buffer, KERNEL_FRAME * frame, int * index, bool * mutex)
private function that enqueue frame into send buffer.

void EnqueueFrameIntoReceiveBuffer ( KERNEL_FRAME buffer, KERNEL_FRAME * frame, int * index, bool * mutex)
private function that enqueue frame into receive buffer.
void KL_Dispacher ( KERNEL_FRAME * frame)

void KL_UART1MessageReceiveHandler ( )
kernel internal event handler for uart1.

void KL_UART2MessageReceiveHandler ( )
kernel internal event handler for uart2.

void KL_UART3MessageReceiveHandler ( )
kernel internal event handler for uart3.

void KL_UART4MessageReceiveHandler ( )
kernel internal event handler for uart4.
void KL_Timer1Interrupt ( )

void KL_SendFrame ( KERNEL_FRAME * frame)
proxy function for dispatching frames made by APIs.

void KL_RegisterDevice ( DEVICE_SLOT slot)
register a device into kernel.

void KL_Bootup ( )
bootup kernel.

void KL_RegisterInstrument ( InstrumentStart function)
register instrument's start function.

simplesect.title: Detailed Description
simplesect.para: Messages produced by device's API and send to Kernel and the kernel delivers them to the port and vice versa. Messages are divided into two types: Real-time which are sent immadiately and normal messages which are piled up into the device buffer and sent by kernel's dispacher engine. Each message is array of charachters. The maximum size of the array is tunable inside the kernel via MAX_MSG_SIZE. If a device message length was equal zero then the kernel assumes that the message was C-Style charachter string. In other words, the message is terminated by a '\0'. So, during enlisting and sending the operation is continued up until the first '\0' is hit. If the message length where not equal to zero, then kernel automatically reads, enlist and transmit it up to a specific message length (see also ConnectionMap.h). Each device type has a specified amount of buffer for sending the message to the device. The device buffer is static array with fixed size. We have tested dynamic memory allocation, but we noticed some problems during runtime. For this, version we have used this static array, but we are planning for turning it into dynamic memory allocation approach for the future implementations. Device buffer is filled in circular linked list fasion. It would be better to seperate the implementaion in a separate file instead of hard coding it inside this kernel file and It is planned for future version.
